metadata.name: NewModule
metadata.title: New Module
metadata.description: Scaffolds the files required for a PowerShell module.

parameter.name: ModuleName
parameter.prompt: Enter the name of the module

parameter.name: ModuleDesc
parameter.prompt: Enter a description of the module (required for publishing to the PowerShell Gallery)

parameter.name: Version
parameter.prompt: Enter the version number of the module

parameter.name: License
parameter.prompt: Select a license (see http://choosealicense.com for help choosing):

parameter.name: Options
parameter.prompt: Select one or more of the following tooling options:

choice.label: Add p&sake build script
choice.help: Adds psake build script that generates the module directory for publishing to the PowerShell Gallery.

choice.label: Add &Pester test support
choice.help: Adds test directory and Pester test for the module manifest file.

choice.label: Add PSScript&Analyzer support
choice.help: Adds script analysis support using PSScriptAnalyzer.

choice.label: Add plat&yPS help generation support
choice.help: Adds help build support using platyPS.

parameter.name: Editor
parameter.prompt: Select one of the supported script editors for better editor integration (or None):

choice.label: Visual Studio &Code
choice.help: Your editor is Visual Studio Code.

requireModule.name: Pester
requireModule.message: Without Pester, you will not be able to run the provided Pester test to validate your module manifest file.`nWithout version 3.4.0, VS Code will not display Pester warnings and errors in the Problems panel.

requireModule.name: psake
requireModule.message: Without psake, you will not be able to run the provided build script to build and/or publish your module.

requireModule.name: PSScriptAnalyzer
requireModule.message: Without PSScriptAnalyzer, you will not be able to perform script analysis, or use the provided options to control script analysis.

requireModule.name: platyPS
requireModule.message: Without platyPS, you will not be able to generate PowerShell external help for your module using markdown.

content.message: Your new PowerShell module project '$PLASTER_PARAM_ModuleName' has been created.

A Pester test has been created to validate the module's manifest file. Add additional tests to the test directory. You can run the Pester tests in your project by executing the 'test' task. Press Ctrl+P, then type 'task test'.
You can build your project by executing the 'build' task. Press Ctrl+P, then type 'task build'. You can publish your project to the PSGallery by pressing Ctrl+P, then type 'task publish'.

You can generate help and additional documentation using platyPS by running the 'build help' task. Press Ctrl+P, then type 'task build help'. Add additional documentation written in platyPS markdown to the docs directory. You can update the help by running the 'build help' task again.
